1. I don't quite understand the reasoning behind this configuration. Could you provide an example of a similar public topology? (Are you trying to set up a switch with dual uplinks?)
2. Can you simulate your desired scenario by increasing the bandwidth of a specific port?
3. Actually, you can specify multiple links, but that would require modifying the code on the ns3 side. You would need to consider the routing policies in such a scenario.

OK,thanks!
we can use Expand the bandwidth of a single link to simulate!

satisfaction_conditions: Supports simulating multiple logical connections between two switches without requiring physical port expansion
Provides a method to increase total bandwidth capacity between switches
Works within existing topology configuration constraints
